answers.answer: "Are these two drugs compatable levothyroxine and sertraline hcl?" - ask your pharmacist."Does your thyroid control your blood sugar?" - influence, yes; control, no.

Yes Zoloft is compatiable with an FT4 med but make sure not taken together...at least an hour apart or you will be 'off your face' so to speak.The Pancreas produces insulin which regulates your blood sugars.When the pancreas doesnt work as well as it should, the body starts to burn sugar from the body fat (type II diabetes) or doesnt get enough insulin (Type I diabetes).Diabetes is an autoimmune disease and you CAN have thyroid issues and also show positive for diabetes.If you have one autoimmune disease, it is possible to have a 2nd one too.

I have recently started sertraline for anxiety and depression, at the same time found I am borderline diabetic.  My average level of glucose reading is 154. Can sertraline have any effect on the pancreas?

I have recently started sertraline for anxiety and depression, at the same time found I am borderline diabetic.  My average level of glucose reading is 154. Can sertraline have any effect on the pancreas?

Smilerdeb is no longer active on the forum... Do you also have a thyroid condition? Or just the borderline diabetes?Quick bit of research and I find that sertaline can increase blood sugar levels.  You might want to discuss this with your doctor.Have you had thyroid levels checked?  Hypothyroidism often causes anxiety and depression and should be ruled out, before anti-anxiety/anti-depressants are taken.If you have current thyroid testing, please post results, with reference ranges, so we can better comment on your situation.
Hi I am taking sertraline also. Have taken it for several years and my doctor just tole me I am borterline diabetic. Does sertraline cause diabetics???
You're asking the same question Vickster asked.. Per my response, sertaline can increase blood sugar levels; high blood sugar levels lead to diabetes.

question: Are these two drugs compatable levothyroxine and sertraline hcl? Does your thyroid control your blood sugar?
title: safe
